title: init truffle issue
body:
- [n ] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

Trying to create a dapp but am having trouble opening new truffle project inside of .json file.

trying command "truffle init" and is supposed to create new app but... nothing of the sort

In dev directory, try command "truffle init" and see what happens.
 the app should be created with and handful of new commands. but it resulted in the error "command not found: truffle"

So I tried to npm uninstall truffle and reinstall but am now met with these errors upon reinstallation:


npm WARN deprecated mkdirp-promise@5.0.1: This package is broken and no longer maintained. 'mkdirp' itself supports promises now, please switch to that.

* npm version (`npm --version`):

So it looks like Truffle is not installing correctly. There are sometimes some problems using npm version 8 to install Truffle. There are a couple of things I think you can try. 

First you could try and update xcode in the app store, if you do this let us know if afterwards you are able to install without the errors that you are receiving.

You can also just downgrade npm to version 6 (`npm install -g npm@6`) and it should install.

Let us know how it goes!

Thank you! I did pretty much that, except I just installed with Brew! It
works out for me. Thanks for the response
